subject: Web3
title: NFTs in Gaming
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: NFTs in Gaming.

hook.text: Gamers spend billions on in-game items they don't truly own. NFTs promise to change that.

buildup.text: If game items were NFTs, players could truly own, sell, or trade them outside the game.

discovery.text: Axie Infinity pioneered play-to-earn. Players in the Philippines earned a living breeding and battling digital creatures.

twist.text: Axie's economy collapsed when new players stopped joining. Earnings depended on infinite growth.

climax.text: Most gamers reject NFTs. They see them as cash grabs, not improvements. The integration remains deeply controversial.

punchline.text: Gamers want fun. NFTs mostly offered them spreadsheets.

quiz.question: Why did Axie Infinity's play-to-earn economy collapse?
options: Earnings depended on infinite new player growth
